info.description: SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll provides User Management (SCIM) 2.0 REST API to help you write and read users and group data. The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) protocol is a proposed standard according to the Request For Comments (RFC) 7664 and 7643. The specification is an HTTP-based protocol that makes managing identities in multi-domain scenarios easier to support via a standardized service.
info.title: User Management (SCIM) for Employee Central Payroll

x-sap-shortText: This service enables you to write and read user data.

externalDocs.description: Identity Provisioning for Employee Central Payroll.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Specifies the index of the first response page in the current set of search results.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of search results per page. A negative value is interpreted as 0. A value of 0 indicates that no resource results are to be returned. The default value is 20.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Defines the search criteria. Possible attribute is displayName and meta.lastModified. Supported operators are : eq (equals), gt (greater than), lt (lower than), ne (not equals), ge (greater than or equals), le (lower than or equals), and, or.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description:
A multi-valued list that indicates attributes names in standard notation to return in the response, overriding the set of attributes that would be returned by default, except minimal Group representation which is always returned. When attribute 'members' is part of the attributes, then id or index paging shall be used in the query.

**Example Description:**
This value is used to query the members of the group using startId and count e.g. **members[startIndex=initial&count=100]**.

parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token
parameters.description: X-CSRF-Token - If the specified value is "Fetch" and the query is successful, the token needed for the change methods is provided.

200.description: Ok - The API returns the list of groups.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was poorly formed.

401.description: Unauthorized - Access denied. Your authentication credentials have been refused.

404.description: Not found. Possible reasons could be that no users match your request.

500.description: Internal Server Error - Something unexpected happened.

post.description: Creates a group with the properties specified in the body.

201.description: Created - The API created the group.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was poorly formed.

401.description: Unauthorized - Access denied. Your authentication credentials have been refused.

403.description: Forbidden - Access denied. A valid CSRF Token is missing.

404.description: Not found. Possible reasons could be that no groups match your request.

409.description: Conflict - The SCIM resource already exists.

500.description: Internal Server Error - Something unexpected happened.

get.description: Returns a group specified by the ID.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description:
A multi-valued list that indicates attributes names in standard notation to return in the response, overriding the set of attributes that would be returned by default, except minimal Group representation which is always returned. When attribute 'members' is part of the attributes, then id or index paging shall be used in the query.

**Example Description:**
This value is used to query the members of the group using startId and count e.g. **members[startIndex=initial&count=100]**.

200.description: OK - The API returns the specified group.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was poorly formed.

401.description: Unauthorized - Access denied. Your authentication credentials have been refused.

404.description: Not found. Possible reasons could be that no groups match your request.

500.description: Internal Server Error - Something unexpected happened.

patch.summary: Updates specific fields of a group
patch.description: Updates only the selected fields of a group specified by the ID.

200.description: OK - The API updated the group.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was poorly formed.

403.description: Forbidden - Access denied. A valid CSRF Token is missing.

404.description: Not found. Possible reasons could be that no groups match your request.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - for example, the ID is not specified in the path.

500.description: Internal Server Error - Something unexpected happened.

put.description: Updates all fields of a group specified by the ID.

200.description: Ok - The API updated the group.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was poorly formed.

401.description: Unauthorized - Access denied. Your authentication credentials have been refused.

403.description: Forbidden - Access denied. A valid CSRF Token is missing.

404.description: Not found. Possible reasons could be that no groups match your request.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - for example, the ID is not specified in the path.

500.description: Internal Server Error - Something unexpected happened.

delete.description: Deletes a group specified by the ID.

204.description: No Content - The API deleted the group.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Specifies the index of the first response page in the current set of search results.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of search results per page. A negative value is interpreted as 0. A value of 0 indicates that no resource results are to be returned. The default value is 20.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description:
A multi-valued list that indicates attributes names in standard notation to return in the response, overriding the set of attributes that would be returned by default, except minimal User representation which is always returned. When attribute 'groups' is part of the attributes, then id or index paging shall be used in the query.

**Example Description:**
This value is used to query the groups of the user using startIndex and count e.g. **groups[startIndex=1&count=100]**.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Defines the search criteria. Possible attribute is displayName and meta.lastModified. Supported operators are : eq (equals), gt (greater than), lt (lower than), ne (not equals), ge (greater than or equals), le (lower than or equals), and, or

parameters.description: X-CSRF-Token - If the specified value is "Fetch" and the query is successful, the token needed for the change methods is provided.

post.description: Creates a user with the properties specified in the body. To add a user, an ID, a primary email, a display name and the "active" status are required.

201.description: Created - The API created the user.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was poorly formed.

401.description: Unauthorized - Access denied. Your authentication credentials have been refused.

403.description: Forbidden - Access denied. A valid CSRF Token is missing.
